summary: This is an email chain from August 26, 2019, between federal prosecutors and law enforcement agents (FBI, OIG) regarding interviews and proffer sessions with inmates housed in L-tier and K-tier of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in relation to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with specific inmates, including one housed across from Epstein's cell, and confirm which inmates have already been interviewed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation; the emails discuss interviewing inmates who were housed near his cell (L-tier) at the time of his death.

events.title: Interviews of inmates in L-tier and K-tier
events.description: Federal prosecutors and agents conducted interviews with inmates housed in L-tier and K-tier of the MCC regarding the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled proffer with inmate from cell across from Epstein
events.description: A proffer session is scheduled with an inmate charged with 4 MS-13 murders who was housed in the cell across from Jeffrey Epstein's cell. He is not a cooperator but wishes to provide information.

events.title: Scheduled proffer session
events.description: A proffer session with an inmate is being scheduled for this date.

events.title: Scheduled proffer session
events.description: A proffer session with an inmate is being scheduled for this date.

keyFacts: Investigators interviewed inmates housed in L-tier and K-tier of the MCC on August 26, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
An inmate charged with 4 MS-13 murders, housed in the cell across from Epstein's, was scheduled for a proffer session on September 3, 2019, to provide information.
Two other inmate proffer sessions were being scheduled for August 28 and 29, 2019.
Investigators had previously interviewed inmates from cells 218, 213, and 215 in L-tier, which were near Epstein's cell.

The email chain indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the FBI, and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) in the investigation into Epstein's death.
